title: I love how people think the Aatrox changes are final and nothing else is going to happen
body: Because no mini-rework Riot has ever done has ever had follow up work to help it. Nope, never. And for the other crowd, just because Rick said the changes were solid, doesn't mean it doesn't need more work. It means it's in the right direction, and that they like the direction.

replies.body:
Yep, there'll be followup needed. We think the pattern the kit changes move Aatrox towards is better, that's not to say the numbers are right however. 

Looking at Aatrox's performance today so far he's having a really tough time of it. Some of that's expected (people who've never played him trying him, people experimenting with builds or doing what used to work but isn't great anymore). We're seeing significantly worse performance than we'd expect from just that though if he was in a good place. We're going to start testing buffs as a result, possibly for the next patch, possibly for a hotfix before then depending on how Aatrox does over the next few days.

Have you considered changing the way his blood well works? It drains awfully fast and is terribly difficult to fill up in a real fight.

Additionally, since the revive is no longer defensively optimized, you should consider shortening how long it takes for Aatrox to re-animate.
These two changes exactly
I think his Blood Rush refresh should also trigger on large/epic jungle monsters. Otherwise he just can't jungle anymore.
@Meddler why you don't give his E a stun instead of slow, or add a mechanic to it to make him able to look down on a target same as other divers {{champion:39}}  {{champion:19}}
the slow is needed, but may i suggest adding a short stun to where the two blades meet? (maybe match the Q range to be able to land on that point for some further synergy)
So give a reward for hitting the tip of the skillshot? Interesting idea.
exactly, its pretty hard to land the tip, and its slow enough that people can get out of the way so you could reasonable put a 1-2 sec stun on it but only where they meet.

Meddler, hotfix for Aatrox is finally live in 7.5 but everybody realized that it wasn't enough to make the champ viable, would be more changes for Aatrox in 7.6? Im all day long spaming Aatrox top (not viable for jungler). I would like you to reply me please :D.

I will respond by letting you know that the way his scalings are displayed isn't intuitive for the players to know how to play him. Either drop the AP scaling or add more of it for starters. Then, might as well take away health scaling on the healing...don't know what you'd replace it with, but good W builds always revolved around lifesteal, and they will even after this rework. And finally, just want to point out that critical strike items are the only thing he can buy viably now because if he gets anything else, he doesn't have anywhere near enough attack speed to get his blood rush going AND have relevant damage to go with it. I'm okay with him doing well with critical strike items personally, but I think it's weird that the player base doesn't know to build it. If the ultimate damage and W healing(just an easy example of a change that wouldn't change much I think) scaled with critical strike stats, then it would be more obvious they should be buying it.

Other than the primary concern over players not knowing what works good on him, there is the idea of what else you might buff. I was getting Essence Reaver and even though the mana part of it isn't necessary on him, the item performed well by giving him a lot of CDR. So, I would target buffs primarily on CDs for his abilities if I were you guys, just my thought. It's difficult to imagine him being tanky working without a lot of attack speed and believe me, I tried Wit's End...it's just not viable...if the cooldowns were reduced then maybe, just maybe, tanky Aatrox would work. How do you get his pool to activate if you're attacking slowly? Got to use E and Q more often. You'd also need to greatly increase the health scaling on the W if you really wanted to stick with that. Maybe add on health scaling into damage on E like Braum has health scaling into damage on his Q.

Probably to push him more towards their newer idea of Divers, but still an offset variation of a Skirmisher. Newer divers, like Vi, Camille, and Warwick, like to build tankier as their kit supports that tankiness with innate damage. Aatrox, with the percent missing health healing, and more sustained DPS through base AD increase on his passive, which means he likes longer fights, also pushes him towards building Tankier, with things like Steraks to help.

Meddler, you guys gutted him. Okay sure you can make his numbers better, but hes not fun to play anymore. How did you guys expect better performance? Every Aatrox main took one look at the changes and instantly knew he was going to do worse. What tools do you use to come to these conclusions? Its mind boggling.

I'm sorry dude, but Riot had 2 years of input from Aatrox mains and you guys ignored nearly all of it.  In fact the changes made his problems worse. 

Keep this in mind too. He is the only fighter or top laner you will see that has no built in blocks, parries, resistances or shields. With the old Aatrox his sustain was his defense. That is severely gutted. So he builds tanky now? So what, anyone can build tanky. The difference is when Olaf does it he still does true damage. When Voli does it he does damage based on his max HP.  Him building tanky makes him do even less damage because his W was completely gutted. 

That bonus AD on his Blood Price in now way compensates for 60-200 plus 100% bonus AD.  The W was a nerf, the slow is much worse now, due to its duration. No one wanted to asked for his Q scaling to be better. 

Also, look at how many champions he will be facing do mixed damage and percent of health damage. Why did you insist on making him even easier to shut down with a few armor items? Why is he the only one not allowed to being doing either true damage, bonus magic damage (like jax) or %of health damage. Furthermore, he has no built in armor pen or crits. 

So Aatrox is the only champion who is basically bare bones. No shields, no blocks, no parries, no built in resistances or tenacity, no built in crits or armor reduction and no magic damage, true damage or percent to health damage.

The reason why his revive doesn't count as a defensive stat in the same category as the ones I mentioned is that the other champiosn defensive stats help keep them alive while doing damage. Nasus bonus health and resistance and health, Pantheon blocks, Fiora spell shields, Riven has a shield that scales off of AD, etc etc etc. These are way more useful in more situations than a revive that leaves you a sitting duck.

The ONLY reason it was okay for him to be such a bare bones champion was his incredibly healing. Not his passive, but his healing. And this gone. 

Please listen to your customers more next time.  Any one of us could have told you these changes were awful with a casual glance.

my question is now
why pick Aatrox over Xin anymore?
or even jax, or trynd

Xins heal is better, gapclose is better, and dps is higher even building tanky. + brings a more reliable chain of cc
and xins ult has utility in a teamfight. + doesnt lose his threat if the enemy just all ins after the new minion wave shows up if aatrox had to recall or cleared the previous wave

Aatrox used to have better mixed damage making itemizing against him harder for non true tanks (who got plenty of resists if aatrox ignored building pen), better healing when it mattered (low hp), and a way to poke. Plus his revive

Jax ramps harder, better gapcloser, still has good mixed damage, naturally bulkier

Tryndamere is tryndamere...

now aatrox lost the mixed damage, his poke is the same as his normal scaling meaning tabis actually screw him hard where before it was manageable, his threat timer is crippled with this new passive. he doesnt ramp that hard because it takes too long to get there. His revive is gated hard enough where the times where it used to matter most are now gone.

I used to consider those 4 the main AA commit and fight guys, and now aatrox just fails to all 3 of them in basically every regard, where before he had some advantages over them to compensate for them being better at some things.
